TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit TextPatternIdentifiers extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains values used as identifiers for .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> exposes detailed information of the textual contents of objects such as edit controls and documents.
UI Automation providers should be written so that they can work in a partial-trust environment. Because UIAutomationClient.dll is not configured for full trust, your provider code should not reference that assembly. If it does so, the code may run in a full-trust environment but then fail in a partial-trust environment.
In particular, do not use fields from classes in UIAutomationClient.dll such as those in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>. Instead, use the equivalent fields from classes in UIAutomationTypes.dll, such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementIdentifiers>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Animations appear on the screen only; the animated text prints, but the animation effect does not.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the [BackgroundColor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp) attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the Culture (<xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>) attribute of a text range down to the sub-language level; for example, Frenchâ€“Switzerland (fr-CH) instead of French (fr).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
See <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] for more detail on the language code format.
The default value is the language of the application [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
> [!NOTE] > There might be cases where the server does not support the language tag or authors cannot use it. In those cases the default applies.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `FontName` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Examples include "Arial Black" and "Arial Narrow".
Values are non-localized.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.String>.
The default value is an `empty string`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `FontSize` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `FontWeight` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Refers to the relative stroke, thickness or boldness of a font.
This is modeled after the `lfWeight` field in [GDI LOGFONT](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/fontext_1wmq.asp). For consistency, the following values have been adopted from LOGFONT: 0=DontCare, 100=Thin, 200=ExtraLight or UltraLight, 300=Light, 400=Normal or Regular, 500=Medium, 600=SemiBold or DemiBold, 700=Bold, 800=ExtraBold or UltraBold, and 900=Heavy or Black.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the [ForegroundColor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp) ([COLORREF](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp)) attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Foreground color is equivalent to the text or font color.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The horizontal text alignment applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment>
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment>

Docs.summary: Identifies the `IndentationFirstLine` (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.TextIndent%2A>) attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The first-line indentation (specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit> unit type value) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `IndentationLeading` (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.TextIndent%2A>) attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The leading indentation (specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit> unit type value) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `IndentationTrailing` (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.TextIndent%2A>) attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The trailing indentation (specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit> unit type value) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `IsHidden` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `IsItalic` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `IsReadOnly` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The read-only state of the document associated with the calling text range.
> [!NOTE] > If a document or file is read-only, but you can still edit it and save it as another file, the text is not considered read-only.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `IsSubscript` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `IsSuperscript` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `MarginBottom` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The bottom margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `MarginLeading` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The leading margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `MarginTop` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The top margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `MarginTrailing` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The trailing margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies whether the value of a given attribute varies over a text range in a rich edit control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A> returns `TextPattern.MixedAttributeValue` to indicate this variation instead of a collection of attribute values.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Object>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `OutlineStyles` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.OutlineStyles>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.OutlineStyles>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `OverlineColor` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).

Docs.summary: Identifies the `OverlineStyle` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the pattern.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `StrikethroughColor` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).

Docs.summary: Identifies the `StrikethroughStyle` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `Tabs` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection of tab stops has each tab stop specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit> unit type value.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are an array of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is an `empty` array.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent TextChangedEvent

Docs.summary: Identifies the event raised whenever textual content is modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
## Examples [!code-cs[UIATextPattern_snip#1052](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/UIATextPattern_snip/SearchWindow.cs#1052)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2052](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/UIATextPattern_snip/SearchWindow.vb#2052)]

Docs.summary: Identifies the `TextFlowDirections` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections>.
The default value is the bitwise combination of the following values: <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections> `|` <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections> `|` <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent TextSelectionChangedEvent

Docs.summary: Identifies the event raised whenever the text selection is modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Some text controls handle the text insertion point (cursor) as a zero-width text selection and might raise `TextSelectionChangedEvent` when the cursor is moved.
> [!NOTE] > To follow cursor movements, UI Automation clients are advised to keep track of insertion point changes by listening for corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element events rather than depending on <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.TextSelectionChangedEvent>.
This identifier is used by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] providers. Client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the `UnderlineColor` attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).

Docs.summary: Identifies the `UnderlineStyle` () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
